abstract: Nearly two-mile-long earthen berm designed to keep invasive Asian carp from reaching Great Lakes from Wabash River watershed in Indiana is nearly complete.
lead_paragraph: A nearly two-mile-long earthen berm through a northeastern Indiana marsh that is designed to keep Asian carp from entering the Great Lakes is almost complete, months after heavy rains temporarily halted the project.

headline.main: Indiana: Barrier to Keep Asian Carp Out of Great Lakes Is Near Completion
headline.print_headline: Indiana: Barrier to Keep Asian Carp Out of Great Lakes Is Near Completion

snippet: A nearly two-mile-long earthen berm through a northeastern Indiana marsh that is designed to keep Asian carp from entering the Great Lakes is almost complete, months after heavy rains temporarily halted the project.
